title: NYC Mayor Adams gets split decision in battle against rats
description: New York City Mayor Eric Adams has scored a split decision with a hearing officer dismissing one summons while upholding another issued by a city inspector citing him for not doing enough to keep rodents at bay from his Brooklyn townhouse
author: BOBBY CAINA CALVAN Associated Press

title: NYC Mayor Adams gets split decision in battle against rats
description: New York City Mayor Eric Adams has scored a split decision with a hearing officer dismissing one summons while upholding another issued by a city inspector citing him for not doing enough to keep rodents at bay from his Brooklyn townhouse
author: BOBBY CAINA CALVAN Associated Press

title: Man's leap saves him during Brooklyn U-Haul rampage
description: The 66-year-old man who frantically leapt out of the way of a rampaging U-Haul truck driver on a Brooklyn sidewalk says he doesn’t know how he did it
author: DEEPTI HAJELA Associated Press

title: Brooklyn dodger: Man's leap saves him during U-Haul rampage
description: The 66-year-old man who frantically leapt out of the way of a rampaging U-Haul truck driver on a Brooklyn sidewalk says he doesn’t know how he did it
author: DEEPTI HAJELA Associated Press

title: U-Haul rampage victim died striving for 'American dream'
description: The man killed when the driver of a U-Haul truck went on a rampage through Brooklyn was a 44-year-old food delivery worker and single father of three
author: BOBBY CAINA CALVAN Associated Press

title: NYC Mayor Eric Adams takes shot at Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis ahead of visit to Staten Island
description: NYC Mayor Eric Adams takes shot at Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis ahead of visit to Staten Islandgo.com

title: U-Haul driver blames 'invisible object' for deadly rampage
description: A U-Haul driver who police say killed one person and injured eight more when he careened onto sidewalks Monday in New York City is saying he “had enough” after seeing an “invisible object” coming toward the truck. Weng Sor, 62,…
author: By MICHAEL R. SISAK and BOBBY CAINA CALVAN - Associated Press

title: Amazon calls staff back to office three days a week
description: The firm joins a slew of other companies that are tightening remote work rules.
author: https://www.facebook.com/bbcnews

title: Suspect Is in Custody After U-Haul Hits and Injures Pedestrians in Brooklyn
description: A man driving a U-Haul box truck hit and injured several pedestrians in Brooklyn on Monday morning, a spokesperson for New York City Mayor Eric Adams confirmed on Twitter.
author: Laura Nahmias

title: Police Stop U-Haul After Report of Pedestrians Struck in NYC
description: The driver of the truck fled the scene after mounting a sidewalk in Brooklyn and injuring several people.

title: New York Has a New Public Spaces Czar to Help De-Clutter City Streets
description: New York City Mayor Eric Adams has hired the city’s first-ever public spaces czar in an effort to help re-open streets and sidewalks that have become overcrowded with outdoor dining, scaffolding, bike lanes and other uses.
author: Cailley LaPara, Gregory Korte

title: Adams Gets Deal With NYC’s Biggest Union, Will Test Remote Work
description: New York Mayor Eric Adams said the city has reached a five-year contract agreement with its largest union, in a deal that grants 3% annual raises for the first four years and creates a remote-work pilot program for some municipal employees.
author: Laura Nahmias, Cailley LaPara

title: NYC’s Anti-Rat Mayor Gets $300 Fine for the Rats at His Brooklyn Townhouse
description: New York City Mayor Eric Adams must pay a $300 fine for harboring rats at his Brooklyn property, an awkward outcome for an elected official who has elevated his battle against vermin from a personal crusade to a political rallying cry.
author: Gregory Korte

title: Canadians Demand NYC 'Immediately Stop' Sending Illegal Aliens to Quebec
description: Officials in Quebec, Canada are demanding New York City Mayor Eric Adams (D) "immediately stop" sending border crossers and illegal aliens to their province.
author: John Binder, John Binder

title: Chick-fil-A is opening a break room for New York food delivery drivers to get coffee or use the restroom between orders, addressing some of the biggest complaints about the job
description: New York food delivery drivers will get access to bathrooms, bike storage, charging outlets, Wi-Fi, and drinks.
author: gdean@insider.com (Grace Dean)

title: New York City Mayor Eric Adams is bussing migrants to the Canadian border amid influx
description: Canada is seeing an influx of migrants entering the country from the United States after New York City Mayor Eric Adams provided them with bus fare to a city just south of the northern border. Now Canadian officials are calling for a revamp to its border poli…
author: CBS News

title: Fraternal Order of Black Firefighters swears in first woman president at Black History Month celebration
description: Firefighter Regina Wilson is the first woman to hold the position since the organization was founded in 1940.
author: CBS New York Team

title: Chick-fil-A opens NYC 'break room' for delivery workers
description: Covid spurred more people to order food out, making delivery workers busier than ever. So Chick-fil-A has built a break room for those in New York City that will be open for a few months, offering refreshments and restrooms in between deliveries.
author: Danielle Wiener-Bronner

title: 8 injured, 2 critically, after U-Haul van drives into pedestrians in Brooklyn
description: Eight people were injured after someone drove a U-Haul van into pedestrians in New York City on Monday morning, an official with the Fire Department of New York told CNN.
author: John Miller, Mark Morales & Shimon Prokupecz

title: NYC's mayor is back-peddling on his return-to-office demands because the city can't fill enough jobs
description: It's a concession to a competitive labor market where the ability to work from home is table stakes for people who don’t need to be on site for their jobs.
author: Gregory Korte, Jo Constantz, Bloomberg

title: New York City two-year investigation nets indictment of 23 alleged Crips gang members: DA
description: The Queens district attorney, alongside NYC Mayor Eric Adams, announced the 28-count indictment against 23 alleged members of the Crips street gang.
author: Greg Wehner

title: Twitter rips Mayor Adams for taunting DeSantis amid visit to NYC: 'Fix your dumb city, dude'
description: New York City Mayor Eric Adams criticized Ron DeSantis with a tweet in which he welcomed the Florida governor to the Big Apple for a law enforcement event.
author: Nikolas Lanum

title: DeSantis team fires back at Eric Adams after he offers to teach Florida governor about NYC 'values'
description: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis' team fired back at New York City Mayor Eric Adams' tweet offering to "teach" the governor about the crime-ridden city's "values."
author: Houston Keene

title: NYC mayor says COVID mandates may need to return, blasts people who say 'I want to do whatever I want'
description: New York City Mayor Eric Adams defended his decision to rescind the COVID-19 vaccine mandate, although those who lost their jobs over it may not return.
author: Greg Wehner

title: NYC Mayor Eric Adams scores split decision in battle against the rats
description: One of Eric Adams' summons was dismissed while the other one was upheld. The summons that was upheld was issued by an inspector citing him for not keeping rats away from his townhouse
author: Associated Press

title: NYC Mayor Adams opens 85th hotel to house immigrants as number of asylum seekers surpasses homeless
description: New York City is housing illegal immigrants in 85 hotels throughout the city in an effort to combat the ongoing migrant crisis.
author: Aubrie Spady

title: DeSantis warns NYC police officers critical race theory 'teaching kids to demonize,' 'hate' law enforcement
description: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis, with 2024 rumors swirling, told New York City law enforcement at a State Island event Monday that critical race theory is teaching kids to “demonize” police.
author: Danielle Wallace

title: Speaker McCarthy to lead House delegation to US-Mexico border
description: House Speaker Kevin McCarthy will lead a House delegation to the U.S.-Mexico border for the first time since taking up the gavel, meeting with U.S. border agents in Arizona.
author: Anders Hagstrom

title: Lady Gaga's father says he would never raise daughters in NYC again: 'This place looks like hell'
description: Lady Gaga's father slammed the current state of New York City, arguing that the spike in crime and garbage-lined streets have resulted in a loss of revenue for his restaurant..
author: Yael Halon

title: Fingerprints of unvaccinated NYC teachers reportedly sent to FBI with 'problem codes': 'Invasion of privacy'
description: Former NYC teachers are outraged after it was revealed the fingerprints of educators who refused to get the COVID vaccine were reportedly sent to the FBI
author: Bailee Hill

title: U-Haul driver was in mental health crisis during deadly New York rampage, police say
description: A man who went on a deadly rampage with a U-Haul in New York City said he started mowing people down after seeing an “invisible object” coming toward him, police said Tuesday.
author: The Associated Press

title: U-Haul driver in custody after multiple people are struck and injured in Brooklyn, officials say
description: A person of interest is in custody and one person is in grave condition after a U-Haul van hit four people in Brooklyn on Monday, authorities said.
author: Marlene Lenthang and Tom Winter

title: Eric Adams 'Happy to Teach' DeSantis Values Amid NYC Trip
description: Adams called out DeSantis for his state's controversial moves, including barring books from schools and sending migrants to Democrat-led cities.
author: Thomas Kika

title: The Consequences of Gun Control
description:
Lawmakers should not support gun laws they would not see enforced.
The post The Consequences of Gun Control appeared first on The American Conservative.
author: John Hirschauer

title: NYC Mayor Eric Adams May Relax 5-Day Office Policy for City Workers as Agency Vacancies Rise
description: New York City Mayor Eric Adams is reconsidering his requirement that city employees work in the office five days a week as jobs go unfilled.
author: Jo Constantz and Gregory Korte / Bloomberg

title: Chiefs QB Patrick Mahomes kept receipts and proved offseason doubters wrong
description: Patrick Mahomes says the #Chiefs heard their doubters in the offseason. Their season-long response was to prove them wrong on the football field. | from @EdEastonJr

title: Updated list of DC candidates the Eagles could target with Jonathan Gannon heading to Arizona
description: We're looking at an updated list of coaching candidates that could replace Jonathan Gannon as the Eagles' defensive coordinator
author: Eagles Wire

title: US mayors call on State Department to lower visitor visa interview wait times
description: More than 40 U.S. mayors called for the State Department to lower visitor visa interview wait times in a letter Monday.
author: USA TODAY, Nathan Diller, USA TODAY

title: Trump's Criminal Defense Attorney Is an Atlanta Hip-Hop Legend
description: Drew Findling built a reputation as hip-hop’s premier criminal defense attorney, representing Cardi B, Migos and Gucci Mane. Now he’s defending Trump from one of the former president’s most potent legal threats.
author: Greg Walters, Josh Visser
